intro: Anathallis comayaguensis, commonly known as the Comayagua mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the humid lowland forests of Central America. It belongs to the Loranthaceae family and typically attaches itself to the branches of host trees, such as those in the genus *Ficus*. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a leathery texture, adapted to reduce water loss in its shaded habitat. Anathallis comayaguensis plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its environment by influencing host tree health and providing resources for various insect pollinators.
